Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

Target_PDS3.target_desc:
Target Description ================== WASP-3 is a star with a detected substellar companion, WASP-3 b, and is a target of the Extrasolar Planet Observation and CHaracterization (EPOCh) phase of the NASA EPOXI mission. Other designations for this star are GSC 02636-00195 and 2MASS J18343163+3539415. The star has the following astrometric and photometric properties:
Spectral type : F7V Apparent V Magnitude : 10.64 Distance : 223 pc Mass : 1.24 (-0.11/+0.06) solar masses Radius : 1.31 (-0.12/+0.06) solar radii RA : 18 34 31.625 (FK5, epoch and equinox 2000) Dec : +35 39 41.55 (FK5, epoch and equinox 2000)
The substellar companion WASP-3 b was discovered in 2007 by the Wide Angle Search for Planets (WASP). The known properties of this extrasolar planet are:
Mass : 1.76 (-0.14/+0.06) Jupiter masses Semi major axis : 0.0317 (+0.001/-0.0006) AU Orbital period : 1.846834 (-/+2e-6) days Eccentricity : 0 Radius : 1.31 (-0.12/+0.05) Jupiter radii Inclination : 85.06 (-0.16/+0.15) deg
The astrometric and photometric properties were taken from the 21 October 2008 update for this planetary system in the Extrasolar Planets Encyclopedia. The encyclopedia is maintained by the Paris Observatory and is available online at http://exoplanet.eu. Please consult this web site for the most up-to-date properties.
